thread.title: TO DO: New art exhibits in Boca Raton, West Palm Beach
thread.title_full: TO DO: New art exhibits in Boca Raton, West Palm Beach | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Post Features Staff
title: TO DO: New art exhibits in Boca Raton, West Palm Beach
text:
PALM BEACH GARDENS
“Swan Lake”
Samuel Rothbort painted “Rye Wagon Going Through Town” in 1956. It is on exhibit at the Boca Raton Museum of Art. Ballet Palm Beach opens its season with “Swan Lake Act II & Other Works” on Saturday (7:30 p.m.) and Sunday (4 p.m.) at the Eissey Campus Theatre at Palm Beach State C In addition, the company will entertain audiences with original works. Tickets start $17. 11051 Campus Drive. 561-207-5900; www.balletpalmbeach.org
DELRAY BEACH
2015-16 season begins
The series “Theatre at Arts Garage” kicks off Sunday and runs through Nov. 15 with “Sex With Strangers.” In this romantic comedy for the digital age — when someone’s existence can be entirely fabricated online — we ask “Who, exactly, is lying in bed next to us?” Olivia, a 40-something writer, unexpectedly encounters a younger sex-blogger, but questions about his past take their relationship through a series of comic and surprising turns. $30-$45. 180 NE First St. 561-450-6357; www.artsgarage.com
WEST PALM BEACH
Learn Fla. history
The Historical Society of Palm Beach County is presenting By Sea and Land: Florida in the Civil War through July 2, 2016, at the Richard and Pat Johnson Palm Beach County History Museum. The exhibit covers the war years and Reconstruction, 1861-1877. The exhibit features stories of Floridians — including Unionists, Confederates and former slaves — and shows how the state contributed to the Confederacy’s efforts and paid the price. Open Monday through Saturday. Free. 300 N. Dixie Highway. 561-832-4164; www.historicalsocietypbc.org
BOCA RATON
1930s Russia
The Boca Raton Museum of Art is presenting Memories of the Shtetl through Jan. 10, 2016. In the late 1930s, Samuel Rothbort began creating “memory paintings” of his native Walkovisk, a small village in Russia. Those paintings (more than 500) have become a cultural resource depicting life in a predominantly Jewish village. Open Tuesday through Sunday. Adults, $12; 65-plus, $10. 501 Plaza Real. 561-392-2500; www.bocamuseum.org
</span
